DOC.brief_title: Study Evaluating Timing Intrauterine Insemination Relation Positive Home Ovulation Prediction Kit
DOC.detailed_description: Intrauterine insemination procedure perform physician 's office . During procedure sperm male partner place directly female partner 's uterus around time ovulation ( release oocyte egg ) . Ovulation predictor kit , available counter pharmacy , test presence luteinizing hormone urine . When test result positive , mean hormone present urine . This sign ovulation . Physicians typically choose perform intrauterine insemination either day positive ovulation test day positive ovulation test . The purpose study determine day intrauterine insemination perform influence chance become pregnant .
DOC.criteria: All couple consist male female partner undergo CC letrozole cycle plus IUI single infertility center ( Midwest Fertility Specialists ) The female partner must age 2139 Infertile couple include diagnosis ( ) unexplained infertility , mild male factor , ovulatory dysfunction , anovulation Evidence normal uterus least unilateral tubal patency saline infusion sonogram hysterosalpingogram within last 2 year Semen analysis male partner must minimal sperm concentration 10 million per milliliter Recurrent miscarriages Nursing mother Diagnoses primary ovarian failure , diminish ovarian reserve ( indicated blood follicle stimulate hormone > 10 milliInternationalUnits/mL and/or antimullerian hormone level < 0.5 ) , abnormal uterine bleeding undetermined origin , ovarian cyst undetermined origin , stage IV endometriosis , sexhormone dependent tumor Documented bilateral tubal obstruction uncorrected uterine anomaly ( e.g . uterine septum ) Previous gonadotropin use and/or previous treatment vitro fertilization Abnormal semen analysis ( sperm concentration le 10 million per mL ) ejaculatory dysfunction male partner Other uncorrected medical condition female partner would contraindication attempt elective ovulation induction ( e.g. , uncontrolled diabetes , intracranial lesion , thyroid adrenal disease )
